div.p: Congress established certain categories of information
that are not required to be released in response to a FOIA request
when release would be harmful to governmental or private interests.
There are nine categories of exempt information,
and they cover information such as classified documents,
privileged communications, and law enforcement interests.
Even if an exemption applies, the Attorney General has encouraged all agencies
to use their discretion and release information
if there is no foreseeable harm in doing so
and disclosure is not otherwise prohibited by law.
